<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 422, 875, 454]]<|/det|>
The lamps are designed to "fail-short". If a filament fails, the lamp shorts so that it has no resistance. The other lamps continue to light and the current increases.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 469, 875, 516]]<|/det|>
The lamps are connected through a fuse that blows when the current rises above 0.9A. At this current, the resistance of each lamp is \(5\%\) greater than its normal working resistance.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 530, 780, 547]]<|/det|>
Calculate the maximum number of lamps that can fail before the fuse blows.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 804, 875, 821]]<|/det|>
<form>number of lamps = ........................................................ [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[800, 835, 875, 853]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 8]
